title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:08 <rrodriguez> has quit  
00:08 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
00:13 <abusenius> has quit  
00:32 <florinciu> has quit  
01:00 <DrLou> has quit  
01:50 <hanasaki> has joined #xwiki  
02:51 <sdumitriu> has quit  
06:39 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:08 <Chami1> has joined #xwiki  
07:36 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
07:58 <venkatna> has joined #xwiki  
07:58 <venkatna> has quit  
08:18 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:38 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
08:52 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
08:59 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:09 <vmassol> has quit  
09:13 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:36 <vmassol> good morning  
09:36 <vmassol> actually just realized that fabio is on holiday so I'll need to find out how to finish my REST JMX resource by myself…. ;)  
09:38 <vmassol> cjdelisle: hi. In the last test run there's no port issue so far. Have you fixed it?  
09:38 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/lastBuild/testReport/  
09:38 <vmassol> (the build isn't over though)  
09:39 <hanasaki> hmmm nice.. hooked into the wbsite  
09:40 <vmassol> yep ;)  
09:40 <vmassol> (except for the author issue)  
09:40 <vmassol> (which we need to fix)  
09:40 <vmassol> (sometimes it reports the wrong author)  
09:41 <hanasaki> what issue is that?  
09:41 <hanasaki> looks like you are mr programer on it.  
09:41 <vmassol> XWiki.hanasaki was modified by XWiki.VincentMassol <— I didn't do this  
09:41 <vmassol> (you did)  
09:44 <hanasaki> hmm xwiki may not be what I need.... looking for a java based opensource/free system that will let users edit their own content and an admin setup the the site(s)  
09:45 <hanasaki> preferably with bloggin/wiki rss like features  
09:45 <vmassol> hanasaki: well you're describing xwiki....  
09:45 <hanasaki> it uses jackrabbit I hear?  
09:46 <hanasaki> embedded?  
09:46 <vmassol> no  
09:46 <vmassol> it uses hibernate with a relational DB  
09:46 <hanasaki> nice  
09:46 <hanasaki> hibernate 3.6?  
09:46 <hanasaki> ages ago thought I read that it used a cms  
09:47 <vmassol> nope  
09:47 <hanasaki> where are images and docs stored?  
09:47 <vmassol> we have 2 options for attachments  
09:47 <vmassol> in the DB  
09:47 <vmassol> (the default right now)  
09:47 <vmassol> or in the filesystem  
09:47 <hanasaki> blobs?  
09:48 <vmassol> right now we're using hibernate <version>3.2.6.ga</version>  
09:48 <vmassol> yes blobs in the DB  
09:48 <hanasaki> any caching or ecache so eachimage doesn't come out of the db everytime?  
09:48 <vmassol> of course  
09:48 <vmassol> we have lots of caches  
09:49 <hanasaki> user authentication and authorization... in ldap?  
09:49 <hanasaki> can it hook into apacheds or activedir?  
09:49 <vmassol> in the DB by default + other integration, a very good one with ldap indeed  
09:49 <vmassol> yes  
09:50 <vmassol> (both)  
09:50 <hanasaki> so if I have 4 groups.. can I delegate an admin to each group to edit their stuff only?  
09:50 <vmassol> the rights system of xwiki is powerful  
09:50 <vmassol> you can do anything you want really  
09:50 <hanasaki> and the user admin... through xwiki or some other system?  thinking only some of the folks I am going to have the same id for an exim email and imap  
09:50 <vmassol> you can even use XEM  
09:51 <vmassol> and have a wiki per group  
09:51 <hanasaki> xem?  
09:51 <vmassol> xwiki enterprise manager  
09:51 <hanasaki> free?  
09:51 <vmassol> yes  
09:51 <vmassol> open source  
09:51 <hanasaki> wiki per group... that mean I need to run one server per group?  
09:51 <vmassol> no  
09:51 <vmassol> one server can handle as many wikis as you want  
09:51 <vmassol> on server = one WAR if you prefer  
09:52 <hanasaki> can I later split them up transparantly? what about failover and load balancing?  
09:52 <vmassol> you can run 10K wikis on a WAR if you really need to  
09:52 <vmassol> sure  
09:52 <vmassol> hanasaki: did you check the doc  
09:52 <hanasaki> url please?  
09:52 <vmassol> because all you're asking is supposed to be in the doc :)  
09:52 <vmassol> if not we need to improve it :)  
09:52 <hanasaki> just getting into it.. I need to get it setup pretty quick.. might use H2 for the DB  
09:52 <vmassol> http://xwiki.org  
09:52 <hanasaki> I like your attitude vmassol  
09:52 <hanasaki> :)  
09:53 <vmassol> :)  
09:53 <hanasaki> have a specific url for the user admin and setup?  like how to config to hit the ldap server and how to admin a user per group  
09:54 <vmassol> admin guide for XE: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/  
09:54 <Denis> has left #xwiki  
09:54 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <hanasaki> then ... when I add posix users and user1 can login to host11 and the exim smtp and imap server... how do I do that?  
09:54 <hanasaki> in xwiki or separate with an ldap editor since tis on part of xwiki  
09:55 <vmassol> I'm not the ldap expert here. Try reading the doc and if you still have questions you can ask here or on our forum/mailing list  
09:55 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:56 <vmassol> btw a good place to look for answer is on http://xwiki.markmail.org  
09:56 <vmassol> good morning tmortagne  
09:56 <+tmortagne> vmassol: hi, just found an important bu in reference serializer  
09:56 <+tmortagne> s/bu/bug/  
09:56 <vmassol> ah? strange that it's surfacing only now  
09:56 <vmassol> (if it's important)  
09:57 <+tmortagne> any bug in here is important :)  
09:57 <vmassol> right  
09:57 <+tmortagne> the problem is that there is not escaping handling of \ itself  
09:58 <vmassol> ok...  
09:58 <vmassol> strange that I didn't put any tests for that  
09:58 <+tmortagne> here is an example of issue produced by that when serializing and then parsing: wiki space\ page -> wiki:space\.page -> wiki space page  
09:59 <vmassol> indeed it's an important bug  
09:59 <vmassol> it means we cannot have pages with \  
10:00 <vmassol> (I was pretty sure I tested that but maybe I'm imagining things)  
10:00 <+tmortagne> my last part is wrong bas copy past it's defaultwiki:defaultspace.wikispacepage actually  
10:00 <vmassol> anyway needs to be fixed quickly indeed  
10:00 <vmassol> good bug to fix in RC1  
10:00 <+tmortagne> problem is that it's actually a design bug, i'm on it but it's not a quick fix  
10:00 <vmassol> right now we need to stabilize 3.1M2  
10:00 <vmassol> ok...  
10:01 <+tmortagne> finishing the jira issue and come back to it  
10:01 <vmassol> ok  
10:01 <vmassol> come back = help on stabilizing?  
10:02 <vmassol> cjdelisle: port is still an issue: last test run: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/lastBuild/testReport/  
10:02 <vmassol> selenium and ui tests still need to be fixed and are not caused by the port issue I believe  
10:02 <+tmortagne> come back to fixing the bug  
10:02 <+tmortagne> (compared to write a jia issue)  
10:03 <vmassol> tmortagne: might be best if yiou help stabilize FTM  
10:03 <vmassol> grrr web standards issues again  
10:03 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/lastBuild/testReport/  
10:03 <+tmortagne> vmassol: i would prefer not releasing with such a bug...  
10:03 <vmassol> ah no  
10:03 <vmassol> tmortagne: we did it for the 10 past releases  
10:03 <vmassol> but I agree for 3.1 final  
10:03 <vmassol> today is release day  
10:03 <vmassol> and we have over 10 tests not passing  
10:04 <vmassol> btw we seemt o have a watchlist issue  
10:04 <vmassol> in almost all tests I've checked on jenkins  
10:04 <+tmortagne> then it's not a release candidate if we know it's not going to be the final ;)  
10:04 <vmassol> for ex:  
10:04 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/699/testReport/org.xwiki.test.webstandards.framework/DefaultValidationTest/Validating\_XHTML\_validity\_for\_\_space\_XWiki\_\_page\_SearchAdmin\_executed\_with\_credentials\_Admin\_admin/  
10:04 <vmassol> this is not a RC  
10:04 <vmassol> it's 3.1M2  
10:04 <vmassol> ah no  
10:04 <vmassol> wait  
10:04 <vmassol> I'm lagging  
10:04 <vmassol> :)  
10:05 <vmassol> we already release M2  
10:05 <vmassol> s/release/released/  
10:05 <hanasaki> uses spring3?  
10:05 <+tmortagne> vmassol: yep seen wtahclist issue this weekend, planned to look at it when I found this bug working on a personal project  
10:05 <hanasaki> log4j or slf4j?  
10:05 <vmassol> hanasaki: no  
10:05 <vmassol> slf4J  
10:05 <vmassol> (since 3.1M2)  
10:06 <+tmortagne> watchlist thing is probably my fault  
10:08 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <hanasaki> can it use mvel or freemarker or only velocity  
10:09 <vmassol> hanasaki: without development only velocity, groovy, ruby, php, python  
10:09 <hanasaki> only php and velocity are tempaters .. the others are languages...  
10:09 <+tmortagne> not exactly actually  
10:09 <+tmortagne> only velocity is supported out of the box but if mvel (don't know this one) or freemarker provide jsr223 bridge it should be easy to use them  
10:09 <hanasaki> I need something suzi office girl can learn  
10:10 <+tmortagne> any language is supported using jsr223  
10:10 <vmassol> well if suzi is a "simple user" then maybe she shouldn't be developing scripts in wiki pages ;) and instead use the code developed by page developers  
10:10 <@cjdelisle> good morning  
10:11 <vmassol> hi cjdelisle  
10:11 <@cjdelisle> 03:53 < vmassol> yes blobs in the DB <-- this is not technically correct, blob is a streamable type which is wraut with proprietary apis and incompatability  
10:12 <@cjdelisle> we use VARBINARY/bytea  
10:12 <hanasaki> what DB's do you see most often used?  
10:12 <vmassol> mysql  
10:13 <@cjdelisle> Postgres is also known to work although multi-wiki (XEM) only works in mysql.  
10:13 <Chami1> has quit  
10:13 <hanasaki> hmmm h2 and postgress are what we use now....  
10:14 <@cjdelisle> Postgres is what is running on my desktop so it is pretty well supported asside from that annoying bit about no multi-wiki.  
10:14 <hanasaki> :( just what vmassol said I might need  
10:15 <hanasaki> cjdelisle:  what's the issue w/ it  
10:15 <vmassol> hanasaki: not really. You could simply use spaces for different groups. Depends on your exact needs  
10:16 <@cjdelisle> In postgres you have to create a whole new tcp connection for each database. Then Hibernate can't do connection pooling and we would need a seperate pool for each db.  
10:17 <@cjdelisle> But yes, almost anything you would need multiple wikis for you can do with multiple spaces  
10:17 <@cjdelisle> Aside from the obvious, providing wiki as a service to customers.  
10:18 <@cjdelisle> Re the tests, my wild theory at the moment is that something is opening a connection on that port and refusing to close it.  
10:19 <hanasaki> vmassol:  just a small yet complete setup  
10:19 <hanasaki> later might migrate to full psotgres..  
10:19 <hanasaki> does xem work w/ h2?  
10:19 <hanasaki> hsqldb?  
10:19 <@cjdelisle> IIRC, you can make a program so you have to kill -4 it to stop it by opening a tcp connection and then filtering FIN and RST packets.  
10:21 <@cjdelisle> For the moment, XEM only works with mysql.  
10:21 <vmassol> tmortagne: is that true?  
10:21 <vmassol> (I thought it was working with other dbs)  
10:21 <vmassol> oracle?  
10:21 <+tmortagne> vmassol: it's supposed to work Oracle yes  
10:22 <hanasaki> since its hibernate based... what's the issue w/ other dbs  
10:22 <@cjdelisle> I kind of tried to avoid recommending Oracle since none of us have it installed.  
10:22 <+tmortagne> only other one I know it's working on but never used it myself  
10:22 <vmassol> tmortagne: does xwiki sas have setup on oracle for xem?  
10:22 <+tmortagne> vmassol: 99% sure  
10:23 <+tmortagne> used to for sure at least  
10:24 <vmassol> ok  
10:24 <mpaun> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <hanasaki> so where does xwiki get its $ from since its opensource?  
10:27 <vmassol> http://xwiki.com  
10:27 <vmassol> (see the list of services/solutions offered)  
10:27 <vmassol> there are other companies offering services too  
10:28 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Support  
10:28 <vmassol> more specifically: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Support#HProfessionalSupport  
10:28 <vmassol> ? http://www.xwiki.com/xwiki/bin/view/Offer/Support  
10:28 <vmassol> ? http://www.xwiki.com/xwiki/bin/view/Offer/Hosting  
10:28 <vmassol> ? http://www.xwiki.com/xwiki/bin/view/Offer/Development  
10:28 <vmassol> ? http://www.xwiki.com/xwiki/bin/view/Offer/Consulting  
10:28 <vmassol> ? http://www.xwiki.com/xwiki/bin/view/Offer/Training  
10:29 <hanasaki> ah  
10:29 <hanasaki> but until the stuff I do grows... I don't need any of that... just for basic out  of the box?  
10:29 <vmassol> it's up to you  
10:29 <hanasaki> cool  
10:30 <hanasaki> hmm no hosting in usa $  
10:30 <hanasaki> lol  
10:30 <hanasaki> but it runs fine in jboss4? tomcat ? jetty?  
10:30 <vmassol> XWiki SAS do hosting for lots of US companies  
10:30 <@cjdelisle> For now I can change every test suite to run under a different port or disable JMX entirely to get some incoming test results.  
10:31 <vmassol> re servlet container yes it works on all of them  
10:31 <hanasaki> thanks folks  
10:31 <vmassol> cjdelisle: ok here's what I propose  
10:31 <hanasaki> off to learn I go  
10:31 <vmassol> I remove the logging FTM in functional tests  
10:31 <vmassol> so that we don't need JMX  
10:31 <vmassol> at the same time I continue my work  
10:31 <vmassol> on the JMX REST resource  
10:31 <vmassol> and when I'm done I re-enable logging in func tests  
10:32 <@cjdelisle> ok so logging connects to the jmx port?  
10:32 <vmassol> this is only to get some special logs for ldap and jgroupos AFAIK  
10:32 <vmassol> nope  
10:32 <vmassol> it's to dynamically configure logging at runtime  
10:32 <vmassol> give me 30 mn  
10:32 <vmassol> doing it now  
10:32 <@cjdelisle> I have a hunch that something is connecting and not releasing the connection.  
10:32 <Chami1> has joined #xwiki  
10:33 <@cjdelisle> Anyway, be back in a little while.  
10:36 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I see poms in platform reference version 3.1-SNAP  in master  
10:37 <vmassol> guys do you know the name of the branch for the RC1 release?  
10:38 <vmassol> (3.1RC1)  
10:38 <vmassol> I'm lost  
10:38 <vmassol> I see:  
10:38 <vmassol> stable-3.1.x     xwiki-3.1M1    origin/stable-3.1.x   origin/xwiki-3.1M1  
10:39 <hanasaki> http://www.agrospheres.eu/    <= so this ref site is all in xwiki>?  
10:41 <vmassol> hanasaki: not this version I think. But you can definitely do this kind of sites with xwiki although it's best when there's collaboration  
10:42 <vmassol> (since otherwise you can just do it in html)  
10:43 <vmassol> hanasaki: this is 100% in xwiki for ex: http://www.curriki.org/  
10:44 <hanasaki> it even takes the donatiosn and charges a creditcard?  
10:44 <vmassol> I don't know the details but probably yes, why not?  
10:45 <hanasaki> so the main page is a velocity page then and its actually edited live within the running xwiki as an admin?  
10:45 <vmassol> forget velocity  
10:45 <vmassol> everything is a wiki page  
10:45 <vmassol> that you can edit with the wiki or wysiwyg editor  
10:45 <hanasaki> hmm nice  
10:45 <vmassol> velocity templates are jus tthere for the skin  
10:46 <hanasaki> so to make the main page... someone with a bit but not a lot of xwiki experience.. how long would it take?  
10:46 <vmassol> the home page is provided as part of our default download  
10:46 <vmassol> so  0 seconds  
10:46 <hanasaki> and it takes standard wiki page markup?  
10:46 <vmassol> if you want to change text it takes maybe 1 mn  
10:47 <hanasaki> nice!@  
10:47 <hanasaki> builtin support for RSS via rome?  
10:47 <+tmortagne> vmassol: you should probably not have xwiki-3.1M1 unless cjdelisle did a mistake did you git pull --prune recently ?  
10:47 <vmassol> hanasaki: yes  
10:47 <vmassol> tmortagne: no I didn't  
10:48 <+tmortagne> git pull does not remove branches which are actually deleted on remote  
10:48 <+tmortagne> you need --prune for that  
10:48 <+tmortagne> which is why sometime to keep branches like xwiki-3.1M1 (unless cjdelisle named it xwiki-3.1M1 instead of xwiki-3.1RC1 )  
10:48 <vmassol> ok it removed one  
10:48 <vmassol>  x [deleted]         (none)     -> origin/xwiki-3.1M1  
10:48 <hanasaki> rome looks stuck at 1.0 and on java.net :( lol no page is there.. just a placeholder  
10:48 <vmassol> so I still have 3  
10:49 <+tmortagne> vmassol: we probably don't have branch for the release  
10:49 <vmassol> tmortagne: I saw that sergiu uopdated all poms  
10:49 <+tmortagne> I thin the plan was to not create one  
10:49 <vmassol> to 3.2-SNAPSHOT on master  
10:49 <+tmortagne> for the branch yes  
10:49 <vmassol> so there must beone....  
10:49 <+tmortagne> but not for the release  
10:49 <hanasaki> so if I use a DB for users and later whan to switch to ldap and use h2 for the db and later want to go to posgress / is there a migratin tool?  
10:49 <+tmortagne> ha you don't have any stable-3.1.x branch ?  
10:50 <vmassol> tmortagne: my master has 3.2-SNAPSHOT  
10:50 <+tmortagne> vmassol: there is one on https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform  
10:50 <+tmortagne> that's normal  
10:50 <vmassol> I see:  
10:50 <vmassol> 10:38  
10:50 <vmassol> stable-3.1.x     xwiki-3.1M1    origin/stable-3.1.x   origin/xwiki-3.1M1      
10:50 <+tmortagne> since trunk is now on 3.2  
10:50 <hanasaki> is there oauth support... don't see it  
10:51 <+tmortagne> vmassol: then checkout 3.1 branch  
10:51 <vmassol> tmortagne: which one?  
10:51 <vmassol> I see 3  
10:51 <+tmortagne> vmassol: again xwiki-3.1M1 does not exist  
10:51 <vmassol> ok checking again  
10:51 <+tmortagne> and stable-3.1.x  is the same as origin/stable-3.1.x  
10:51 <vmassol> ah ok  
10:51 <+tmortagne> one is your local and the other the remote  
10:51 <vmassol> it lists local and remots  
10:51 <vmassol> I see  
10:52 <vmassol> I'(m not sure I understand the naming of branches yet  
10:52 <vmassol> (why would something not released be named stable beats me)  
10:53 <+tmortagne> vmassol: it's a stable branch in the sense that it's in RC and we need to move trunk on 3.2  
10:53 <+tmortagne> we are not going to rename the branch later, would be a pain for nothing  
10:53 <vmassol> yeah.. which is why I was preferring not having stable int he name at all… anyway  
10:54 <vmassol> at least I kniw which one to checkout thanks  
10:54 <hanasaki> XWiki cannot search in multiple domains (as of XWiki 1.5).  
10:55 <hanasaki> and it looks lke the user admin msut be done outside of xwiki.. http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/LDAPAuthenticationUseCases  
10:56 <hanasaki> there are no really good user admins gui's for ldap... :(  
10:56 <hanasaki> bbl.. msg me if you like  
10:56 <hanasaki> night  
10:58 <+tmortagne> hanasaki: yes no multiserver but you can setup LDAP in XWiki, but there is not easy to use UI for it you have to edit XWikiPreference object directly  
10:59 <+tmortagne> the reference document is http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Authentication, http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/LDAPAuthenticationUseCases just list some setup examples  
10:59 <hanasaki> the ideal would be xwiki with oauth (not sure hwat server to use... suggestions) and the oauth uses ldap in the backend so that email and OS login can be done from the ldap too  
11:00 <+tmortagne> you will have to write your own authenticator for that  
11:13 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:16 <vmassol> cjdelisle: since you rolled back my change about ipv4 you need to fix the comments in the pom  
11:17 <vmassol> I personally don't think it's a good idea but since you seem sureof yourself  
11:17 <vmassol> (at least fix the comments which are wrong nw)  
11:17 <vmassol> s/nw/now/  
11:17 <vmassol> you also forgot to roll back some of the changes, in platform  
11:18 <vmassol> I'd like tmortagne's opinion too on this  
11:19 <@cjdelisle> No, we can put your change back.  
11:19 <@cjdelisle> I was primarily doing it because everything was broken on my computer. I have ifconfig del my ip6 addresses so that should not be an issue for me anymore.  
11:20 <@cjdelisle> I was not sure what it was and I have seen ip6 lead to weird behavior like that before.  
11:20 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I always prefer the simplest possible thing that works so less stuff in pom.xml is my prefernce  
11:20 <@cjdelisle> Ok, it is more complex to have a duel stack (it will fail if ip6 is misconfigured) but that's ok with me.

13:17 <vmassol> guys to merge a specific change I did on a branch into another branch I need to use git cherry-pick?  
13:17 <@cjdelisle> yes  
13:18 <@cjdelisle> git cherry-pick <the sha1 of the revision>  
13:24 <@sdumitriu> Or git cherry-pick <branch name>  
13:25 <vmassol> sdumitriu: isn't that the same as git merge <branch name>?  
13:25 <vmassol> I thought the point of cherry pick was to pick a specific commit  
13:25 <vmassol> (vs git merge)  
13:27 <@sdumitriu> No, it's not the same  
13:27 <@sdumitriu> merge unites two branches  
13:27 <@sdumitriu> git cp only applies the changes from a commit  
13:28 <@sdumitriu> The branch name is not pointing to the whole branch  
13:28 <@sdumitriu> It points to the commit on the top of the branch  
13:28 <vmassol> ah ok so the last commit  
13:28 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
13:28 <vmassol> got it  
13:28 <@sdumitriu> git cp master => head of master  
13:28 <@sdumitriu> git cp master~ => the previous commit on master

13:50 <@sdumitriu> Since the two branches have too many differences (with all the directory renames), it won't find a file unless it looks exactly the same between the two versions  
13:51 <+tmortagne> possible it looks exactly the same but I would not bet for it  
13:51 <@sdumitriu> It matches if the file has the same SHA1

15:46 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Why do we use @Inject for loggers? Is there something wrong with LoggerFactory.getLogger?  
15:51 <vmassol> sdumitriu: yes statics are bad  
15:52 <vmassol> they are actually the opposite to component dev  
15:52 <vmassol> there are lots of reasons:  
15:52 <vmassol> - much easier to mock  
15:52 <vmassol> - hide implementation  
15:53 <vmassol> - homogeneity with other stuff being injected  
15:53 <vmassol> to name a few  
15:53 <vmassol> ideally it should be the same for non components (they should get the logger from the CM ideally)
